utils

Class DataMgr

  • java.lang.Object
    • utils.DataMgr

  • public class DataMgr
extends java.lang.Object
    The class acts as an I/O Manager class for saving and loading data for complex objects in the library such as Graph, HGraph, and properties Hashtable objects. The class is thread-safe (reentrant).

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011

    Company:

      static Graph readGraphFromFile2(java.lang.String filename)
      filename format is of the form: [ numarcs numnodes starta enda [weighta] [...] [weight_node1...] ] The starta, enda are in [1...num_nodes] weighta is double (non-negative) node weights after arcs listing, if they exist, are double (non-negative)
      static Graph readGraphFromhMeTiSFile(java.lang.String filename)
      filename format is of the form: [ numarcs numnodes 1 weighta starta enda [...] ] The starta, enda are in [1...num_nodes] weighta is int (non-negative)
      static Graph readGraphFromhMeTiSFile(java.lang.String filename, java.lang.String labelfile)
      same as above method, only that the labelfile serves to read the labels for each of the nodes in the Graph being created
      static HGraph readHGraphFromhMeTiSFile(java.lang.String filename)
      filename format is of the form: [ numarcs numnodes [1] [weighta] node1 node2 ...
      static double[][] readMatrixFromFile(java.lang.String filename)
      reads a file of exactly the same format as the one described in readVectorsFromFile(String) and interprets it as a 2D matrix of double elements.
      static int[] readNumericLabelsFromFile(java.lang.String filename)
      reads numbers from a file (one integer in each consecutive line) and returns them as an int[].
      static java.util.Hashtable readPropsFromFile(java.lang.String filename)
      In case key is the keyword class, the key value is the next token in the line, and the object to be constructed together with its string arguments is given in the rest of the line In case key is the keyword rndgen, the RndUtil class's seed is populated with the value of this line (long int).
      static java.util.Vector readSparseVectorsFEFromFile(java.lang.String filename)
      reads the vectors from a file of the form [ numdocs totaldimensions dim,val [dim,val] [...] ] dim is in [1...totaldimensions] the documents are represented using full storage requirements (as a normal double[]) taking up a lot of space, but also maintaining an index of the non-zero positions for very fast getQuick(i) and getIthNonnZeroPos(i) operations.
      static java.util.Vector readSparseVectorsFromFile(java.lang.String filename)
      reads the vectors from a file of the form [ numdocs totaldimensions dim,val [dim,val] [...] ] dim is in [1...totaldimensions] the documents are represented as a sparse vector representation of a vector in a vector space of dimension totaldimensions
      static java.util.Vector readSparseVectorsMTFromFile(java.lang.String filename)
      reads the vectors from a file of the form [ numdocs totaldimensions dim,val [dim,val] [...] ] dim is in [1...totaldimensions] the documents are represented as a sparse vector representation of a vector in a vector space of dimension totaldimensions
      static java.util.Vector readSparseVectorsMTFromFileAndNormalize(java.lang.String filename)
      same as the method readSparseVectorsFromFile(String filename) except that each VectorIntf object is normalized (in L2 norm) to unity.
      static java.util.Vector readVectorsFromFile(java.lang.String filename)

      static java.util.Vector readVectorsFromFileAndNormalize(java.lang.String filename)

    • Method Detail

      • getUniqueId

        public static long getUniqueId()
        return a globally unique identifier, in a thread-safe manner.
        Returns:
        long

      • readPropsFromFile

        public static java.util.Hashtable readPropsFromFile(java.lang.String filename)
                                             throws java.io.IOException
        In case key is the keyword class, the key value is the next token in the line, and the object to be constructed together with its string arguments is given in the rest of the line In case key is the keyword rndgen, the RndUtil class's seed is populated with the value of this line (long int). The seed does not need to be stored in the Hashtable returned. Also, if a 3rd argument is provided, it indicates the number of distinct threads to require access to RndUtil, and thus it sets the required extra instances of Random objects needed. file format is key,value[,classname][,opts] [...] Empty lines and lines starting with # are ignored.
        Parameters:
        filename - String
        Returns:
        Hashtable
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • readVectorsFromFile

        public static java.util.Vector readVectorsFromFile(java.lang.String filename)
                                            throws java.io.IOException
        reads the vectors from a file of the form [ numdocs totaldimensions dim,val [dim,val] [...] ] dim is in [1...totaldimensions] the documents are represented as a vector representation of a vector in a vector space of dimension totaldimensions. If a pair does not appear for a vector, the value for this coordinate is assumed zero.
        Parameters:
        filename - String
        Returns:
        Vector Vector
        Throws:
        IOException, - ClustererException
        java.io.IOException

      • readHGraphFromhMeTiSFile

        public static HGraph readHGraphFromhMeTiSFile(java.lang.String filename)
                                       throws java.io.IOException,
                                              GraphException
        filename format is of the form: [ numarcs numnodes [1] [weighta] node1 node2 ... nodek [...] ] The nodei are in [1...numnodes] weighta is int (non-negative). If it does not exist (the third value in the first line does not exist), then its value is 1.
        Parameters:
        filename - String
        Returns:
        HGraph
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        GraphException

      • writeGraphToFile

        public static void writeGraphToFile(Graph g,
                    java.lang.String filename)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        takes as input an already constructed graph, and prints it in MeTiS format in the file specified in the second argument. The format of this output file is as follows: numnodes numarcs ... starta enda weight starta, enda are in [0,...,numnodes-1]
        Parameters:
        g - Graph
        filename - String
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • writeGraphToFile2

        public static void writeGraphToFile2(Graph g,
                     java.lang.String filename)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        takes as input an already constructed graph, and prints it in MeTiS format in the file specified in the second argument. The format of this output file is as follows: numarcs numnodes ... starta enda weight ... nodeweight ... starta, enda are in [1,...,numnodes] nodeweight are double values, the first corresponds to the 1st node etc.
        Parameters:
        g - Graph
        filename - String
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • writeGraphToHGRFile

        public static void writeGraphToHGRFile(Graph g,
                       java.lang.String filename)
                                throws java.io.IOException
        takes as input an already constructed graph, and prints it in HMeTiS format in the file specified in the second argument. The format of this output file is specified in the comments for method writeClusterEnsembleToHGRFile()
        Parameters:
        g - Graph
        filename - String
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • writeGraphToGRFile

        public static void writeGraphToGRFile(Graph g,
                      java.lang.String filename)
                               throws java.io.IOException
        takes as input an already constructed graph, and prints it in MeTiS format in the file specified in the second argument. The format of this output file is as follows: numnodes numarcs 1 ... nbor_id1 edgeweight_1 nbor_id2 edgeweight_2 ...
        Parameters:
        g - Graph
        filename - String
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
